system.description: Automatically equipped in each empty hand slot.

ALSO: Lucky Dumbass, Absolute Bufoon

  • Your antics usually leave chaos in their wake. What’s one memorable incident you caused?

  • There was one time you fast-talked yourself into trouble. How did you get out?

  • Name an item that has seemingly no useful applications, and describe how it once saved your life.

  • What’s this one lie of yours that everyone just seems to keep falling for?

IMPROVISER FREE BENEFITS
  •  Permanently increase your maximum Inventory Points by 2.

IMPROVISER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.OYUkvXolOyvRgigE]{Point and Click} (SL2)

Once per scene, when you spend a Fabula Point to alter the current situation or the story, gain 【SL】 IP.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.dmKJkUnO9itj5YEv]{Combine Items} (SL2)

When you perform the Inventory action to produce an item, you may produce a second, different item that has an IP cost of 【4 - SL】 or greater: Treat both uses as if they were the same action, combine their associated costs, and merge the effects of the resulting items. If they are somehow incompatible, resolve the effects of the first, and then those of the latter.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.MPaqVpCBlyPUbrAl]{Dialog Tree} (SL3)

When you erase or mark segments of a Clock thanks to your lies or sense of humor, roll 【SL】 d3 and choose one of them: If it’s a 1, erase 1 segment from the clock; if it’s a 3, mark 1 segment from the clock.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.BDiDiCvnVwUahUzy]{Whoops!}

Before performing a Check, you may declare it as a Fumble due to a clumsy accident or silly coincidence. You cannot do this on Checks that may not generate Opportunities, such as Support Checks. You gain Fabula Points as normal as part of this Fumble, and you and the GM must choose together which Opportunity you generated.

Additionally, choose one ally whenever you get a Fumble: They recover 10 MP.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.IGVYZxDJZvY59qJ3]{Witty Remark} (SL3)

During a Conflict Scene and when you perform a Check against a creature that can hear you, you may spend up to 【SL x 5】 MP: Gain a +1 bonus to that Check for every 5 MP spent this way.

HEROIC SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.HZ302IoqtvywpGU7]{The Perfect Distraction}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.ZTmNmIU2hNPubX2E]{Bumbling Idiot}

CREDIT

Class Design, Writing and Development Nitro

When you perform the Inventory action to produce an item, you may produce a second, different item that has an IP cost of 【4 - SL】 or greater: Treat both uses as if they were the same action, combine their associated costs, and merge the effects of the resulting items. If they are somehow incompatible, resolve the effects of the first, and then those of the latter.
During a Conflict Scene and when you perform a Check against a creature that can hear you, you may spend up to 【SL x 5】 MP: Gain a +1 bonus to that Check for every 5 MP spent this way.

data.description:
ALCHEMY

Also: Chemistry, Bombs, Mutations

You may perform the Inventory action to rapidly craft a potion with powerful but somewhat unpredictable effects. When you do so, choose one type of mix among those you have unlocked (basic, advanced or superior) and spend the appropriate amount of Inventory Points. 

 

MixIP Cost Description
Basic3 Roll two d20s and assign one to target and one to effect. 
Advanced4 Roll three d20s and assign one to target and one to effect. 
Superior5 Roll four d20s and assign one to target and one to effect. 

 

When you create a mix, roll the amount of twenty-sided dice indicated by that mix, then assign one of those rolls to the target table (below) and one to the effect table (on the right). Discard all remaining dice, then describe the effects of the mix!

Example: You spend 5 Inventory Points for a superior mix and roll four twenty-sided dice. You roll 3, 14, 9 and 4. You might assign 14 to target and 9 to effect to grant yourself and all allies Resistance to air and fire; or you could go on the offensive and assign 9 to target and 4 to effect to deal bolt damage to a single enemy; or even assign 9 to target and 14 to effect to inflict four status effects on that foe!

Whatever your choice, the two dice you don't assign will be discarded.

The two effects marked with "Any" on the effect table are always available and can be chosen if none of the available effects appeal to you. 

 

TARGET

Die The potion affects... 
1-6 ... you or one ally you can see that is present on the scene. 
7-11 ... one enemy you can see that is present on the scene. 
12-16 ... you and every ally present on the scene. 
17-20 ... every enemy present on the scene. 

 

EFFECT

Die Each creature affected by the potion... 
Any ... suffers @DMG[20 poison] damage.
Any ... recovers @GAIN[30 hp]. 
1 ... treats their Dexterity (@EFFECT[dex-up e:eot i:2 t:source]) and Might (@EFFECT[mig-up e:eot i:2 t:source]) dice as if they were one size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the end of your next turn. 

2 ... treats their Insight (@EFFECT[ins-up e:eot i:2 t:source]) and Willpower (@EFFECT[wlp-up e:eot i:2 t:source]) dice as if they were one size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the end of your next turn. 

3 ... suffers @DMG[20 air] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 air] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 air] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
4 ... suffers @DMG[20 bolt] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 bolt] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 bolt] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
5 ... suffers @DMG[20 dark] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 dark] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 dark] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
6 ... suffers @DMG[20 earth] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 earth] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 earth] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
7 ... suffers @DMG[20 fire] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 fire] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 fire] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
8 ... suffers @DMG[20 ice] damage. This amount increases to @DMG[30 ice] damage if you are level 20 or higher, or to @DMG[40 ice] damage if you are level 40 or higher. 
9 ... gains Resistance to air (@TYPE[affinity air resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) and fire (@TYPE[affinity fire resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) damage until the end of the scene. 
10 ... gains Resistance to bolt (@TYPE[affinity bolt resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) and ice (@TYPE[affinity ice resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) damage until the end of the scene. 
11 ... gains Resistance to dark (@TYPE[affinity dark resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) and earth (@TYPE[affinity earth resistance e:eos i:1 t:source]) damage until the end of the scene. 
12 ... suffers @EFFECT[enraged]. 
13 ... suffers @EFFECT[poisoned]. 
14 ... suffers @EFFECT[dazed], @EFFECT[shaken], @EFFECT[slow], and @EFFECT[weak]. 
15 ... recovers from all status effects. 
16-17 ... recovers @GAIN[50 hp] and @GAIN[50 mp]
18 ... recovers @GAIN[100 hp]
19 ... recovers @GAIN[100 mp]
20 ... recovers @GAIN[100 hp] and @GAIN[100 mp]
data.basic:
For 3 Inventory Points, roll two d20s and assign one to target and one to effect.

  • You Spend: @LOSS[3 ip]
data.advanced:
For 4 Inventory Points, roll three d20s and assign one to target and one to effect.

  • You Spend: @LOSS[4 ip]
data.superior:
For 5 Inventory Points, roll four d20s and assign one to target and one to effect.

  • You Spend: @LOSS[5 ip]

summary.value: Words are only as good as they actions that follow them.

system.description:
ALSO: Ambassador, Diplomat, Entertainer

Some are graceful and ever smiling, others are subtle and witty: Orators are as good at reading someone’s heart as they are at rounding up allies for their cause, sometimes unintentionally. The words of an Orator may rekindle spirits or plunge their opponents into despair: over the centuries, some Orators’ talents have brought entire nations to ruin… and just as many have granted fallen kingdoms a chance to rise from their very ashes.

ORATOR FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Mind Points by 5.

ORATOR SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.DtEiCkDsC1amYABn]{Condemn} (SL4)

You may use an action and spend 5 Mind Points to perform an Opposed 【INS + WLP】 Check against a creature that can hear and understand you — describe your accusations! If you succeed, the target loses 【SL × 10】 Mind Points and suffers dazed or shaken (your choice).

You gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 to your 【INS + WLP】 Checks for this Skill.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.04DiGVKhF3DtmJ4n]{Encourage} (SL6)

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend 5 Mind Points to choose another creature that can hear and understand you. That creature recovers 【SL × 5】 Hit Points and chooses Dexterity, Insight, Might, or Willpower: they treat the chosen Attribute as being one die size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the start of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.lK9onKSiMuQEe3zd]{My Trust In You} (SL2)

After another Player Character who is able to hear you performs a Check, you may spend 1 Fabula Point and invoke one of their Traits or Bonds in order to let them reroll dice or improve the Result of the Check (following the normal rules). Then, if you have a Bond towards that character, they recover 【SL × 10】 Mind Points.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.GjmqoWAJ4szsk0om]{Persuasive} (SL2)

When you successfully perform a Check to fill or erase sections of a Clock, if your approach relied on charm, diplomacy, deception or intimidation, you may spend up to 【SL × 20】 Mind Points. If you do, fill or erase an additional section of that Clock for every 20 Mind Points you spend this way.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.ucCrtRAvv2qX8aJO]{Unexpected Ally}

You may use an action and spend 1 Fabula Point to choose a non-hostile creature able to hear and understand you. If you do, that creature becomes helpful towards you so long as you are kind and respectful to them and your requests are reasonable.

summary.value: I like to think that what we have today was not a gift from the gods.

system.description:
ALSO: Alchemist, Magitech Engineer, Mechanic

Tinkerers possess exceptional ingenuity and are known for their eccentric and marvelous inventions. They travel the world in an endless search for lost theories and ancient machinery, eyes glimmering whenever they witness the wonders of architecture and engineering. In a way, Tinkerers could be seen as the ultimate dreamers and rebels, challenging the very rules of nature and society in their pursuit of a better future.

TINKERER FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Inventory Points by 2.
  • You may initiate Projects.

TINKERER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.2MoV74xWJnF5Ru8u]{Emergency Item}

Once per conflict scene, if you are in Crisis, you may perform an additional action on your turn. This action must be the Inventory action.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.0ErPA4Q0P97ZPwPE]{Gadgets} (SL5)

When you first acquire this Skill, choose a gadget type: alchemy, infusion, or magitech (see Core Rulebook, page 212). You gain its basic benefits.

Whenever you take this Skill again, choose one option: you gain the basic benefits of a new gadget type; or you gain the advanced benefits of a gadget type whose basic benefits you already obtained; or you gain the superior benefits of a gadget type whose advanced benefits you already obtained.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.xzyAHegWwSaysYqV]{Potion Rain} (SL2)

When you create a potion that restores a single creature's HP and/or MP, you may have it affect up to 【SL】 additional creatures. If you do, the potion only restores half the normal amount of HP and MP to each creature.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.S64zqBVdaYA3I5LW]{Secret Formula} (SL5)

When you create a potion or magisphere whose effects restore HP and/or MP, each restored amount is increased by 【SL × 5】.

When you create an elemental shard, potion or magisphere that deals damage, that item deals 【SL】 extra damage.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.6pJAB6E29I15q1gU]{Visionary} (SL5)

When you work on a Project, up to 【SL × 100】 zenit of material costs are automatically paid; additionally, you generate an additional 【SL】 progress every day. If multiple characters with this Skill work on the same Project, the effects will be cumulative.

INVENTION TYPES

  • For gadget breakdown and a list of Gadgets, refer to: @UUID[Compendium.projectfu.handouts.JournalEntry.TV4Cj3UI0LWNZaOk]{Gadget Rules}

  • To automate, VTT Instructions can be found here: @UUID[Compendium.projectfu.handouts.JournalEntry.TV4Cj3UI0LWNZaOk.JournalEntryPage.7D5mpbaYddiztH1W]{Gadget VTT Instructions}

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend 5 MP to choose another creature that can hear and understand you. That creature recovers 【SL × 5】 Hit Points and chooses Dexterity, Insight, Might, or Willpower; they treat the chosen Attribute as being one die size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the start of your next turn.

  • Target Recovers: @GAIN[5*$sl hp]{SL × 5 HP}

  • Target Receive: @EFFECT[dex-up e:sot i:1 t:source], @EFFECT[ins-up e:sot i:1 t:source], @EFFECT[mig-up e:sot i:1 t:source], or @EFFECT[wlp-up e:sot i:1 t:source]

When you successfully perform a Check to fill or erase sections of a Clock, if your approach relied on charm, diplomacy, deception, or intimidation, you may spend up to 【SL × 20】 Mind Points. If you do, fill or erase an additional section of that Clock for every 20 Mind Points you spend this way.

When you first acquire this Skill, choose a gadget type: alchemy, infusion, or magitech (see Core Rulebook, page 212). You gain its basic benefits.

Whenever you take this Skill again, choose one option: you gain the basic benefits of a new gadget type; or you gain the advanced benefits of a gadget type whose basic benefits you already obtained; or you gain the superior benefits of a gadget type whose advanced benefits you already obtained.

  • For gadget breakdown and a list of Gadgets, refer to: @UUID[Compendium.projectfu.handouts.JournalEntry.TV4Cj3UI0LWNZaOk]{Gadget Rules}

  • To automate, VTT Instructions can be found here: @UUID[Compendium.projectfu.handouts.JournalEntry.TV4Cj3UI0LWNZaOk.JournalEntryPage.7D5mpbaYddiztH1W]{Gadget VTT Instructions}

summary.value: One creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (10 Air, 10 Bolt, 10 Earth, 10 Fire, or 10 Ice).

system.description:
For 2 Inventory Points, one creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (air, bolt, earth, fire, or ice).

  • Target Suffers: @DMG[10 air], @DMG[10 bolt], @DMG[10 earth], @DMG[10 fire], or @DMG[10 ice]

summary.value: This allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

system.description: For 4 Inventory Points, this allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 hp].
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 mp].

summary.value: One creature recovers from a single status effect.

system.description: For 2 Inventory Points, one creature recovers from a single status effect.
